Key Match Events: Msakini Youssef scored the only goal of the match from the penalty spot in the 87th minute after defender Lawrence Chaziya fouled Ltaief Sayfallah in the box.
Pre-Game Insights: Malawi National Football Team, the Flames, were hoping for back-to-back victory in the World Cup qualifiers after beating Liberia 1-0 on Friday.
Post-Match Reflections: Despite the loss, Mabedi said there were several positives that could be drawn from the match.
Banda, who was withdrawn due to injury, was disappointed with the loss.
Tunisia Coach Jalel Kadri, through an interpreter, said they deserved the win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Flames had a grand game in the first half as they exchanged passes and created chances which were not utilised.
Attacker Wisdom Mpinganjira, on his first start for the Flames, had a grand game and caused plenty of problems for Tunisia defenders.
On the other hand, goalkeeper Brighton Munthali kept the Flames in the match after he denied Khenisi Yassine.
